PLACEHOLDER Evaluating Limits Practice

1

Direct Substitution

Evaluate these limits using direct substitution:

1.1 lim⁡x→3(2x2−x+5)\lim_{x \to 3} (2x^2 - x + 5)limx→3​(2x2−x+5)

1.2 lim⁡x→−1x3+2x−1x2+4\lim_{x \to -1} \frac{x^3 + 2x - 1}{x^2 + 4}limx→−1​x2+4x3+2x−1​

1.3 lim⁡x→0sin⁡(x2+1)\lim_{x \to 0} \sin(x^2 + 1)limx→0​sin(x2+1)

2

Algebraic Manipulation

These limits require factoring or rationalizing:

2.1 lim⁡x→5x2−25x−5\lim_{x \to 5} \frac{x^2 - 25}{x - 5}limx→5​x−5x2−25​

2.2 lim⁡x→2x3−8x2−4\lim_{x \to 2} \frac{x^3 - 8}{x^2 - 4}limx→2​x2−4x3−8​

2.3 lim⁡x→9x−3x−9\lim_{x \to 9} \frac{\sqrt{x} - 3}{x - 9}limx→9​x−9x​−3​

2.4 lim⁡h→0x+h−xh\lim_{h \to 0} \frac{\sqrt{x + h} - \sqrt{x}}{h}limh→0​hx+h​−x​​ (rationalize the numerator)

3

One-Sided Limits

Evaluate the following one-sided limits and determine if the two-sided limit exists:

3.1 f(x)={x+1if x<23x−3if x≥2f(x) = \begin{cases} x + 1 & \text{if } x < 2 \\ 3x - 3 & \text{if } x \geq 2 \end{cases}f(x)={x+13x−3​if x<2if x≥2​

Find: lim⁡x→2−f(x)\lim_{x \to 2^-} f(x)limx→2−​f(x), lim⁡x→2+f(x)\lim_{x \to 2^+} f(x)limx→2+​f(x), and lim⁡x→2f(x)\lim_{x \to 2} f(x)limx→2​f(x)

3.2 g(x)=∣x−1∣x−1g(x) = \frac{|x - 1|}{x - 1}g(x)=x−1∣x−1∣​

Find: lim⁡x→1−g(x)\lim_{x \to 1^-} g(x)limx→1−​g(x), lim⁡x→1+g(x)\lim_{x \to 1^+} g(x)limx→1+​g(x), and lim⁡x→1g(x)\lim_{x \to 1} g(x)limx→1​g(x)

4

Limits Involving Trigonometry

4.1 lim⁡x→0sin⁡3xx\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{\sin 3x}{x}limx→0​xsin3x​

4.2 lim⁡x→01−cos⁡xx2\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{1 - \cos x}{x^2}limx→0​x21−cosx​

4.3 lim⁡x→0tan⁡xx\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{\tan x}{x}limx→0​xtanx​

5

Challenge Problems

5.1 lim⁡x→∞3x2+x−12x2−5x+3\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{3x^2 + x - 1}{2x^2 - 5x + 3}limx→∞​2x2−5x+33x2+x−1​

5.2 lim⁡x→0ex−1x\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{e^x - 1}{x}limx→0​xex−1​ (if you know about exponentials)

5.3 Find aaa and bbb such that lim⁡x→1ax2+bx−2x−1=5\lim_{x \to 1} \frac{ax^2 + bx - 2}{x - 1} = 5limx→1​x−1ax2+bx−2​=5

Solution Strategies

For Indeterminate Forms (00\frac{0}{0}00​):

  1. Factor numerator and denominator
  2. Rationalize if square roots are involved
  3. Use trigonometric identities for trig functions

For One-Sided Limits:

  • Approach from the specified direction
  • Be careful with absolute values and piecewise functions

Remember These Key Limits:

  • lim⁡x→0sin⁡xx=1\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{\sin x}{x} = 1limx→0​xsinx​=1
  • lim⁡x→01−cos⁡xx2=12\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{1 - \cos x}{x^2} = \frac{1}{2}limx→0​x21−cosx​=21​

Class Work Instructions

  1. Work in pairs for the first 20 minutes
  2. Present solutions on the board
  3. Discuss different approaches to the same problem
  4. Ask questions about techniques you don't understand

Common Mistakes to Avoid

  • Don't just substitute if you get 00\frac{0}{0}00​
  • Remember to check both sides for one-sided limits
  • Be careful with the signs when factoring
  • Don't forget to simplify after canceling terms
